title: GM+Subaru partnership dies; Toyota+Subaru partnership born;
body: <p>I had high hopes about the Subaru/GM partnership. I was hoping to see an AWD <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/archive/2004/05/17/GM_Hy_Wire.aspx">Hywire</a>, or maybe a hydrogen-powered <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/archive/2003/06/09/320.aspx">WRX</a>. At least I was hoping for cheaper Subaru parts (which I haven't seen). Instead all it resulted in was a crappy looking <a href="http://www.saabcentral.com/features/9-2x_index.php">Saabaru</a>. Ah well, I guess some things weren't meant to last.</p><p>Now <a href="http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20051005/ap_on_bi_ge/japan_toyota">Toyota is buying the stake in Fuji Heavy Industries (Subaru's parent company)</a>. So I'll get my hopes up for an AWD Prius or maybe a hybrid Outback. I'm guessing the Subaru US plants will stay open and keep making cars since it has to save all kinds of money in shipping them over here, but who knows.</p>
bodyArticleHtml:
2005-10-06

GM+Subaru partnership dies; Toyota+Subaru partnership born;

I had high hopes about the Subaru/GM partnership. I was hoping to see an AWD
